page.title: 06CATTLE MARKETS IN PERTH
page.content: { Hay's}market is 152 years old and covers about seven acres. There are twenty full_time employees although up to twelve casual workers are taken on for sales. Stock from all over Scotland is sold to farmers from the south of England. Although they do not have bull sales, Hay's do auction other animals such as sheep in common with MacDonald and Fraser's and they also sell horses. The two markets function in basically the same way and although there is an overlap of spheres of influence there is a large enough demand for both to survive. In the areas immediately around both markets{agricultural suppliers and {services}such as farm machinery distributors, veterinary services,and financial advisors predominate. ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
